pr_title: Enable support for bootstrapping CentOS/Oracle Linux 6, 7 and 8 on Uyuni and SUSE Manager

timeline.bodyText:
We have product ids for them and should make use of it.
For centos as well.
timeline.author: mcalmer

replies.bodyText:
Then I see two problems:
a) What to do about existing CentOS bootstrap entries? They are already created. Can we just append -uyuni for the existing entries and hope users will start using them?
b) I don't have the list of IDs, can you provide them? Or @lucidd? I'd need them for CentOS6/7/8 and Oracle6/7/8 base schannels.
What's the benefit of using PDIDs here vs BASECHANNEL if this forces us to duplicate entries?
replies.author: juliogonzalez

replies.bodyText: Clarified with @lucidd at rocket.chat, we don't need BETAPDIDs for CentOS and Oracle, as we'll control that from sumatoolbox.
replies.author: juliogonzalez

replies.bodyText:
C6i386 PDID : [-10, 1681], 'BETAPDID' : [2063]
C6x86_64 PDID : [-11, 1682], 'BETAPDID' : [2064]
C7x86_64 PDID : [-12, 1683], 'BETAPDID' : [2065]
C8x86_64 PDID : [-13, 2007], 'BETAPDID' : [2066]
OL7x86_64 PDID : [-14, 1683], 'BETAPDID' : [2065]
OL6i386 PDID : [-16, 1681], 'BETAPDID' : [2063]
OL6x86_64 PDID : [-15, 1682], 'BETAPDID' : [2064]
OL8x86_64 PDID : [-17, 2007], 'BETAPDID' : [2066]
@juliogonzalez these are the numbers we need
replies.author: mcalmer
